Job_Description: Our Company:With 150 employees and locations in Austin, Los Angeles and Tampa, Studio III Marketing is a rapidly expanding digital marketing company on the forefront of marketing for medical aesthetics, legal, multi-location groups and national brands, with over 700 clients nationally. Studio III Marketing was founded in 2011 with the initial goal to become a premier boutique marketing firm where a client’s needs were handled fully in house and with superior results in mind. The name Studio 3 or Studio III was picked with each “I” representing a key purpose and intention behind our unique approach to marketing. Innovative, Intuitive and Ingenious. From the beginning, we have strived to focus on each of those points to create unique and high-end marketing strategies for our clients. While we are a full service marketing agency and do every step of our process in-house, we specialize in the following fields:Website design and developmentSEO - Search Engine OptimizationPPC (Pay per click) advertising,Facebook and Instagram AdvertisingSocial Media and Influencer MarketingEmail MarketingCustom Photo and Video AssetsThe team:The team consists of 3 developers and one lead developer who work together on building websites in WordPress. The team meets daily to plan and discuss projects, and to collaborate. You will work with a content and SEO team to create high-quality websites that meet our client's needs.Role and Responsibilities:As a Junior WordPress Developer, you will be responsible for building and testing responsive, highly-customized open source CMS-managed websites using HTML, CSS, and JS based on project specifications.You will work from and contribute to flexible boilerplate themes, update existing websites with layouts and designs that fit or improve upon existing standards, and collaborate with other developers and/or designers throughout the design and development cycle.Additionally, you will bring your design eye to the work you're developing and fill in the gaps to create a finished product that provides a high-quality user experience and meets the client's needs.You will also be encouraged to discover, filter, absorb, and share smart solutions with the team and contribute to the company's efficiency.Qualifications:A strong web development portfolio demonstrating a working knowledge of clean and efficient coding practices, user experience, and attention to design detail.Extensive knowledge of HTML/CSS, accessibility guidelines, and SEO practices.Strong organizational time-management skills, including the ability to contribute to several concurrent projects and deadlines.Ability to work independently or as part of a collaborative development team.Ability to work in a Mac environment.Experience building and testing responsive, highly-customized open source CMS-managed websites (primarily WordPress).Ability to work quickly when needed, be flexible to changes, and able to strike a strong balance between perfectionism and value for the client.An optimistic, can-do attitude; effective listening skills; assertiveness, and objectivity.Personally accountable, responsible, and dedicated to creating value and success for our clients.An ongoing interest in learning and self-improvement. Enigma is an early-stage startup building a Cyber Awareness Training tool for modern teams. Our training focuses on hyper-specific content that spotlights skills relevant to employees’ individual roles, ensuring everyone is well-prepared to prevent cyber incidents. We do this through interactive, bite-sized puzzles that are easy to digest, quick to complete and reinforce key security concepts. No more boring slides or tedious videos.Our customers include Fortune 500 companies as well as some of the world’s fastest-growing startups. We're also are backed by top Silicon Valley's investors including General Catalyst and Bloomberg Beta.Working at EnigmaWe're an async-first, fully remote, and distributed startup hiring across the United States (PST - EST timezones). Read about our values and how we've set ourselves up for success here.What’s the role?We’re looking for a senior front-end developer to help us build the user interface for our engaging, interactive Security Awareness Training product. This is a contract, project-based position for approximately 2-3 months at 30+ hours per week, with the potential for long-term employment.Role details:architect new front-end features using Next.js and Tailwind.cssdefine maintainable and readable standards in our codebasework with our engineering team to connect the front-end code to our databaseYou have:several years of full-stack engineering experience, preferably in a fast-growth environmenta deep understanding of web frameworks and when to use specific technologiesthe ability to quickly design, architect, and build new featuresthe desire to mentor junior talent and build a high-performing engineering cultureattention to detail and the ability to do “finished work”tireless work ethic and accountability — if you say you’ll handle it, it’s as good as doneYou'll use:our frontend is built in React.js + Next.js, and (almost) everything is strongly typed using TypeScript, for our general sanityour database runs on AWS RDS (using PostgreSQL), and we use Auth0 for user managementour infrastructure is currently on Vercel, which makes deployments/rollbacks one-clickCompensation depends on experience. This is a contract, project-based position for approximately 2-3 months at 30+ hours per week, with the potential for long-term employment.Enigma is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Enigma is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities.
